feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 7:04PM AKST until February 13 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Chukchi Sea Coast. * WHEN...Through noon Sunday.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 7:04PM AKST until February 13 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 50 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula. * WHEN...Through noon Sunday.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 7:04PM AKST until February 13 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 50 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Snow and blowing snow will cause briefly low visibility. * WHERE...St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 7:04PM AKST until February 13 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Storm total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches are expected. * WHERE...Lower Yukon Valley. * WHEN...Until noon Sunday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 2:55PM AKST until February 14 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SUNDAY TO 3 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. East-northeast winds 30 to 35 mph with gusts to 40 mph. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Pribilof Islands.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 11:08AM AKST until February 13 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Plan on slippery road conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 14 inches, are expected.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 11:08AM AKST until February 14 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SUNDAY TO 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Plan on slippery road conditions. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected. Visibility one half mile or less at times.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 11:04AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wind Chill near 60 Below... Wind Chill will hover in the 40 to 60 below range through the weekend. Cold temperatures continue across the Arctic with lows in the 30s to 40s below, while highs will be in the 20s and 30s below. Wind will generally be less than 10 mph through Sunday, except on
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range; Northern Arctic Coast; Northwestern Brooks Range; Western Arctic Coast

cap:geocode.value: AKZ201 AKZ202 AKZ203 AKZ204 AKZ205 AKZ206

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 11:01AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wind Chill 40 to 60 Below... Wind Chill will hover in the 40 to 60 below range through the weekend. Cold temperatures continue in the Chukchi Sea and Norton Sound Regions with low temperatures in the 20s to 30s below, while high temperatures will be in the teens and 20s below.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 10:59AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...3 To 5 Inches Of Snow Tonight Through Sunday... Snow is expected to develop Saturday evening across the Central Interior and continue into Sunday evening. Between 3 and 5 inches of snow is expected by Sunday evening when the snow tapers off. In Fairbanks 3 to 4 inches of snow is expected, with 5 inches of snow from Two Rivers east.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 8:54PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ANOTHER VERY COLD NIGHT ACROSS NORTHEAST WISCONSIN... An arctic air mass remains over northeast Wisconsin tonight which will lead to very cold temperatures. Low temperatures are expected to be the coldest across north-central Wisconsin with readings in the teens below zero, with readings ranging from the single digits above and below zero across the rest of the area.
